comments.body: This is a great idea, and I think the gear upgrading idea should definitely be expanded upon with things other than Netherite. However, before we begin adding new dimensions we should give the end some love first, because it seems quite barren.

I like the format of this idea, however I think you could go even further and have lots of similar materials, each adding a specific ability, like the lava resistance.
Enderite would fit the naming scheme, and I think the tools should such items they mine / drop into your inventory (useful in the end where there are big drops) and the armour should deflect shulker bullets.
If we are adding this ill accept the upgrade template for Netherite and this material.
There are literally netherite blocks....that even have metallic sounds.

Also your suggestion for netherite doors and all is really neat, but consider that so far we haven't received these sorts of variants for any metal as yet. I still support this, but maybe write a large suggestion (or this more focused one if you like) by itself so people can see it from the title. I'd vote for it.

I like the wither resistance part, it is extremely hard to build a complicated wither cage, and netherite is so rare that most people wouldn't invest in making enough blocks to contain a wither, giving it an OP use seeing as it is so rare. maybe the armor would also be wither EFFECT resistant, see onyx from the NetherX mod for 1.6MC that has a version of the hoglin, piglin, and other really good ideas for the nether.
Moved this to Blocks, Tools, and items, as this is requesting new items.

Netherite Metal Door-  Looks like a solid, dark steel door with rivets around the edge and a wheel latch to open and close.  (think Bulkhead doors on a submarine)  Benefits of the door: This is a redstone required door just like the iron door, however it is blast/burn proof and will not break even if the block beneath it is broken.

Netherite Metal Trap Door- Has a similar texture of the upper half of the netherite metal door. (a solid, dark steel door with rivets surrounding the edges)  Benefits of this trap door: This has the same indestructibility as the netherite door and will require redstone to open/close it, however unlike a normal iron trap door its un-powered state (Open/Closed) is dependent on the direction it's placed.  Meaning you could place it so it starts open without power by placing it at the top/bottom side of a block or closed without power when placed on any of the other 4 sides of a block. (like a normal trap door)

Netherite Pressure Plate- Textured the same as a netherite trap door without rivets.  Benefits: Same indestructibility as other netherite metal objects but can not be activated by mobs.  It can only be activated by item entities that land on it.  (think of the opposite of a stone pressure plate)

Netherite Metal Bars- A dark and dangerous variant of iron bars.  Has the classic netherite metal color but has spikes at the top of the upper most layer.  Benefit: Causes damage like a cactus when touched, and has the standard netherite metal durability.
Another thing is it cannot be transformed into a large chest , just like when you put two ender chests together
Crafted with 9 crystallised honey.
Or alternatively, a honeycomb block
Or both
I think this would be a great block for the crystallized honey, and maybe it could have a slowing, but healing affect. similar to terraria
@jarom Duncan good idea
This would be a great idea! And perhaps you can uncrystalize it with a heat source close by as an example, fire! Or a desert just as it would crystalize in  a cold biome!
Who here would like to cause unbearable destruction?
16 is way to much, for any explosive, four is much more reasonable.
Trust me, I would've gone with 9 instead but seeing that the original TNT Block does have 16 sticks in it, it makes sense.
Plus it's not like they have the damage and blast radius of TNT. That's why it's reduced.

You wouldn't use TNT to make dynamite tho as they are completely different compounds. Disassembling the TNT would just give you individual sticks of TNT not dynamite. That would be your throwable. Dynamite should be crafted from scratch with it's own unique recipe (nitroglycerin + clay maybe?). With that said, TNT is not made from gunpowder either so maybe they're not going for realism. Dynamite is also stronger than TNT so it's blast radius would actually be larger. I would very much like to see dynamite added as a more powerful explosive. It would be a great way to excavate large areas/cause unbearable destruction. :-)
I definitely think there needs to be a great variety of explosions sizes, including smaller. My daughter likes to take maps and make them look like ruins.

I can see where you are coming from, but the problem is that your idea is of no use because, unlike with signs, almost nobody ever uses wooden tools except for their first few minutes in survival mode. I don't see any need to add stuff to the game that nobody would ever want to actually use, do you see what I mean?

Now that the nether update is out, this should especially be a feature that should be spread to shields, bows, and fishing rods as well as the standard wooden tools. There doesn’t need to be any effect other than aesthetic.
Same with stone tools
Yes, maybe with iron ingots or blocks
Please have this added to the game
by right clicking the anvil with an iron ingot, just like with an iron golem?
True, just like the iron golem costs so much iron, it's possible to easily repair him. So if it was possible to repair the anvil, it would save a lot of iron, like the iron golem.

This remains relevant for the devs to consider. The anvil is rather expensive at 31 iron ingots total comparatively to its purpose and average usage (~25 uses). Don't assume all players are going to build an iron farm! One of its purposes, to repair items, remain underused in part due to the anvil being expensive to replace (the other part being that only restoring 25% item durability if using materials is also very overpriced, considering it often takes only 2-3 of the same material to make the item).

Being able to repair it similarly to how you feed an iron golem an iron ingot would be consistent with an existing method, but since a right-click normally opens the UI this would mean either the player would have to crouch to repair it, or that the UI will not open if right-clicked while holding the repair material. Both solutions would be acceptable imo.

Since the anvil actually breaks after taking damage only three times (and there only being a 12% chance of it taking damage) a single iron ingot is understandably too cheap to repair it. Instead an iron block (equating to 9 iron ingots) would be a reasonable cost for repairing 1 stage of damage. If further balancing is needed then the chance of it taking damage could also be adjusted.

Either way, please consider this!
How about using iron to repair the anvil. Just use one iron ingot per stage of damage.
This makes no sense; diamond is a mineral, not a metal. I don't think you can extract anything meaningful from diamonds by just heating it up as much as possible.
No.  First of all, diamond is a mineral, no a metal.  It doesn’t melt.  Second of all, the burning point of diamond is ridiculously high.
wow. didn't realize a game where you try not to get killed by zombies, skeletons, and creepers (among other things), as well as try to kill a dragon yourself, needed to be so grounded in reality.

I think the fact that we can craft armor from diamonds to begin with throws the logic of the entire process out the window.

The fact that iron, gold, and chain armor can all be smelted down to a nugget gives this idea some amount of logic.

I'm just not sure I see the point.  The main source of iron/gold/chain gear that I melt down is mob drops from my spawner based farms.  Getting diamond armor from that kind of farm is extremely rare, so I doubt I'd ever get enough diamond nuggets to get one full diamond back.
This could work. My idea... Some fireworks require diamonds. Making them very expensive. Breaking a diamond makes diamond shards. Use the diamond shards for the firework effect.

This could be useful, especially with the village and pillage update where it is easier than ever to just get throwaway diamond items to unlock new tiers of trading. or be used in a sort of disassemble system.
I made an idea about more chains, and diamond nuggets could be used to make Diamond Chain if they decide they want to add Diamond Chain? Thank you!

Maybe not diamond nuggets, but what about diamond chips?  Diamond chips are a real thing, used in both jewelry and tools.  A diamond chip is an excellent analog to golden and iron nuggets and now netherite scrap. They could be used as the byproduct in recycling of diamond armor, tools and weapons, and also used for other new purposes, like adding a protective and/or decorative layer/sheen to other stuff.

Broken, used and defective diamonds are in fact recycled into chips (and dust) for other purposes, and while we can't quite "craft" a diamond from diamond chips in the real world, it would make perfect sense in Minecraft.

Another possible name would be diamond facet.  This has nice imagery, and diamonds are "made up of" facets, even if not quite so "real world" as diamond chips.
Good idea, but perhaps rename them to diamond shards, which would make more sense imo.

I love the idea of recycling diamond armour into nuggets (or shards or chips). The name nuggets matches gold and iron, shards sounds the coolest, and chips is the most realistic, any of them could work. I would prefer if you could combine 4 diamond shards to make a diamond instead of 9 diamond nuggets.

It has a good reason to exist, you can find useless vanishing and binding diamond armour that you can not combine in a crafting table anymore. It would be also nice to have diamond nuggets used for cosmetics i don't know if a chain would fit into minecraft's style very well but a ring or something else would be cool.

I don't think diamond nuggets make any sense, even within the logic of Minecraft. But breaking down diamond equipment to diamond shards, and using these shards instead of a full diamond in firework recipes, would be a great change. The current recipe is very expensive, obviously partly by design, but I think this change would keep those fireworks feeling special while not being something nobody ever bothers to craft.

I don't think it makes sense to be able to combine diamond shards into a full diamond, so I'd be fine if they couldn't be recombined, but amethyst shards work that way so there is precedent for it.
Villagers use would go up even more!
Diamond Shards Not Nuggets
I would like diamond nuggets: If and ONLY IF they do NOT also add a smelting recipie to obtain it, (nor any other way to make diamonds renewable.)
The issue is that pretty much any spawner design you would want to use to take advantage of having a spawner where you want it would not have any floor, at least not right underneath the spawner...
Way too op.
As much as this makes sense we can't be given the option to do so because of how ridiculously op it is.

I like the idea and think that it should be in the game but the fact that it gets more efficient with every mossy cobblestone there is you should take that idea down make it like this:

Silk touch with only a diamond picaxe can allow you to get the spawner and the mob in it so you can place it were ever you go but you can only get one by useing silk touch with a Diamond picaxe only
Maybe it only had a 15% drop rate even with silk touch?
Well it would be better if you could get it with the new Netherite Pickaxe
Maybe you would need to add water to the recipe as a way of rinsing it off to clean it, otherwise you might get food poisoning.
Could use a bowl of salad with carrots and tomatoes and cheese.
Salad would make a good healthy meal.
Salad sounds like a great idea! And it would also be very healthy!
Sure, this seems like a nice aesthetic block.  Plus it would be a way to store logs more compactly.

how will it be obtained?Ink Sacs?(because squids are silent)

How rare will it be?
Ink Sacs are not a bad idea but it could be a noisy thing too (like the magma cream for fire resistance). But since I have no other idea, let's say ink sacs.

Should be very short lived.  Maybe enchanting an awkward potion with silk touch would give the potion.  The player would be completely silent, and if someone else were attacked by them, there would be no knock back; their hearts would just silently drop.  Paired with invisibility, mobs would not notice you at all if you weren’t wearing armor.
I'm thinking Paper should be the ingredient just because it's so light and the Feather item is already part of another potion.
I liked so much that idea

It could be cool for the caves and cliffs update, because of Warden and Sculk Sensor. Like in a multiplayer game, where players could use Sculk Sensor to detect invisible players, it's a good thing for the gameplay.
I have thought about getting the potion through the warden's heart.

Um, there already are “redstone based trap.for players or mobs” which “damage or kill them.”  They are “useful for hunting.”  Again, most traps kill mobs entirely “(like rabbit)”

A simple trap is to dig a 1x1x1 hole in the ground, place TNT in the hole, and put a pressure plate on the TNT.  Dig the hole deeper for a guaranteed kill.

There are many variants of traps using redstone in Minecraft.  You could have players or mobs fall into lava, get shoved into a cactus, die by drowning, become trapped forever, or get hurt some other way.  Just customize your own.

I don't think that it should use redstone but rather it should be a pressure plate with two sticks by either side and iron ingots on top of the sticks. If you put a vine over the pressure plate then it becomes a disguised trap

Oh wow, I agree with this post immensely. 

More colors would be great for every player that plays the game. There are also many other Minecraft communities and servers that are focused on Mapart. I think this would be a great addition to the game. 

pls add!
yes please all the pretty colors would be amazing!! different shades of pink and green and orange please
Please add olive green

Definitely! The other smithing templates are purely decorative and completely optional, while this template completely upends progression in the game and makes the highest-tier resource unreasonably rare and nonrenewable.
I agree. The difficulty is too high and finding bastion remnants is too tedious.

I agree. Me and my friends found two bastion remnants so far and have only found two templates in the entirety of them both. This means we have to spend precious diamonds on the netherite upgrade. Although I think the template is a good idea, it should be easier to duplicate (maybe with amethyst, which currently doesn't have a super strong use), or maybe not need to duplicated, but rather reusable.
Agreed. I have never gotten Netherite legitimately, but I don't want Mojang to make it harder. I say keep the armor trims, but make it so that Netherite armor or tools can be crafted the old way.
I have the same

Exactly! It's already hard to find it so why would they even add the smithing upgrade? It was already ok when they added the smithing table without needing the netherite, the community was alright with that, so why would they ever change it up when they know it is just extra work and would make them get A LOT of backlash for it? Keep the trims, remove the smithing upgrade. Simple. Sometimes thing DO NOT need to be changed. THEY DO NOT.
please, i just don't want to go to a bastion in every world
details on like sides of towers on castles etccc like plsss 🥲🥲🥲
How do we still not have vertical slabs yet??
Sería ideal que funcionen como las escaleras que se les puede dar dirección dependiendo de a qué parte del bloque estés mirando cuando pones el bloque

Considering how many maps one has to make for something similar and only being able to do this in Java at the moment, I second the idea of being allowed to do named banners on maps for bedrock. It'll make getting through the nether so much easier. Also great for adventure maps.
This Should Be Added In The 1.20 Update So You Can Name Your Areas Adding to the story aspect of this update.
También necesito que lo agreguen a Minecraft Bedrock
Item transport pipes wouldn’t need to be copper. Copper could be used for filters for sorting items in a pipe network. Copper needs to be used for wiring generators to electric furnaces and stuff
This would be so good and give copper more purpose

I agree, and it would make an excellent decorative block as well.  It wouldn't be that hard to make work.  Give each pipe a single inventory space, but no interface.  To get items out you have to either break the pipe or connect it to a container.  Pipes can only have one output direction, but you can connect multiple input points.  If two output or input points are placed adjacent, there should be clear space between them and the pipes should appear capped.

The recipe would be simple too, probably just a diagonal of three copper ingots.  Personally, I think that it should produce pipe at a minimum of a 1:1 ingot to pipe ratio.  This would make item transportation systems exponentially cheaper.

Also, copper doesn't have enough uses yet, and it would be a fantastic use case for it.  Copper pipes would be a lot cheaper than hoppers, say 3 copper for 3 pipes or something.  Maybe the copper pipes could operate just like hoppers, only they need a hopper on the receiving end to transport items.  Having cheap copper pipes would enable a mechanism for players to transport items longer distances without having to build lots of expensive hoppers using up all your iron.  I can think of lots of use cases for copper pipe as a transport mechanism.

Gold is a soft metal (hence its durability) its main use seems to be the following:

1. get a mending and efficiency enchanted gold pickaxe, use that to break all the stone.

2. get a fortune enchanted netherite pick, use that to break everything valuable, increasing your yield.
Weird Minecraft logic. I vote for this.
Je to divné ale hlavně som sa pozrel sem aby som si uistil že sa to nedá.
Gold pickaxes are practically useless, but this would actually make me excited to find one in a chest.

Bro, Bedrock is better. To make it even better, change all the sounds in Bedrock to match Java except mob spawners. Mob spawner sounds are already updated so please update every sounds to match Java to make it even better. Back to gold. Please increase the gold pickaxe durability to make it between iron and diamond ones. Change the gold pickaxe's mining level from 0 to 2.5 to match between iron and diamond. Same as other gold tools. Only do this for Bedrock.
